DataElement.preferredName: Concomitant Medication Change Since Last Report
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indication whether or not there was a change in concomitant medications since the last report.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Concomitant Medication Domain Concomitant Agent Change Since Last Report
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to concomitant medication administration._A pharmaceutical agent other than agent(s) tested in a given protocol that is administered to or used by a subject either prior to or during the study. Supportive care and essential ancillary medications required by a treatment regimen should be clearly identified. A protocol complete instructions including appropriate indication, dosage, administration route, schedule, restrictions to use, and any other relevant data should be explicitly stated. Concept also refers to substance(s) used prior or during the study that are not specified by the protocol._The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character._Subsequent to; after._Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining._A short textual account; having provided a short account.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to concomitant medication administration.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to concomitant medication administration.

Property.preferredName: Concomitant Agent Change Since Last Report
Property.preferredDefinition: A pharmaceutical agent other than agent(s) tested in a given protocol that is administered to or used by a subject either prior to or during the study. Supportive care and essential ancillary medications required by a treatment regimen should be clearly identified. A protocol complete instructions including appropriate indication, dosage, administration route, schedule, restrictions to use, and any other relevant data should be explicitly stated. Concept also refers to substance(s) used prior or during the study that are not specified by the protocol.:The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.:Subsequent to; after.:Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.:A short textual account; having provided a short account.

Concepts.definition: A pharmaceutical agent other than agent(s) tested in a given protocol that is administered to or used by a subject either prior to or during the study. Supportive care and essential ancillary medications required by a treatment regimen should be clearly identified. A protocol's complete instructions including appropriate indication, dosage, administration route, schedule, restrictions to use, and any other relevant data should be explicitly stated. Concept also refers to substance(s) used prior or during the study that are not specified by the protocol.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.
Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.
A short textual account; having provided a short account.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
